title: BBC Local Live: Devon & Cornwall on Wednesday 21 June 2017 - BBC News
summary: police investigate unexplained death in padstow .
man shot during antigua robbery now blind .
fire crews believe residential home blaze was started deliberately .
former headteacher had 'cavalier attitude ' to pupil safety .
teen saves dad with cpr learnt from tv .
fire crews leave large gorse blaze site .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on thursday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for devon and cornwall have finished for the day , but we 'll be back at 08:00 on thursday with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
do n't forget spotlight on bbc one later .
there will also be news through the night on your bbc local radio station .

documents.title: cornwall spaceport backers welcome queen 's speech
text: cornwall 's proposed spaceport could be one step closer after the introduction of a space industry bill .
the bill , which was announced as part of the queen 's speech , will introduce new powers to allow launches from british soil .
it will licence new commercial spaceflight technologies , including spaceplanes and satellite launch systems , and create a regulatory framework for the operation of uk spaceports .

spaceport director miles carden said : we are determined that cornwall will play an important role in the development of commercial space launch by offering safe and low-cost access to space from newquay , with spacecraft tracking and communications facilities from goonhilly .
the next step in our spaceport cornwall bid will be presenting our plans to the uk space agency alongside our commercial partners , and we expect that to happen in a matter of weeks . ''
author: Sophie Malcolm
BBC News Online

documents.title: police seize drugs in newquay 'after community concerns '
text: police in newquay say they executed drugs warrants simultaneously in a housing estate `` as a result of community concerns over the supply and use of controlled drugs '' .
one man was arrested after officers executed three warrants on the mayfield estate on tuesday .
a quantity of suspected class a and b drugs were seized during searches of properties in hawkins road , mayfield crescent and trelawney road , officers said .
inspector dave meredith said the work was `` sending a clear and robust message to persons involved in the supply and use of controlled drugs in newquay '' .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: latest weather : a warm evening before possible thundery rain overnight
text: another very warm evening is expected .
however , it will cloud over on the lizard before it gets dark and showery rain across the county during the night .
minimum temperature : 14c ( 57f ) .
showers may become heavy and thundery for a time during the morning , particularly in the southeast .
however , they will die out later , leaving a bright dry afternoon with sunny spells .
however , it will feel much fresher .
maximum temperature : 21c ( 70f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: police warning about dogs in vehicles
text: a police officer in plymouth has taken to twitter to warn dog owners about the risks of keeping dogs inside vehicles on hot days .
not a suitable vehicle to leave dogs in on the hottest day of the year .
owner told to make other arrangements .
# dogsdieinhotcars # plymouth

documents.title: family of man shot in antigua robbery 'truly grateful ' for £ 103k fundraising to fly him home
text: the family of a man whose life was saved by a fundraising campaign say they are `` truly grateful '' to more than 1,700 people who paid for his return to the uk after he was shot during a robbery at his parents ' restaurant in antigua .
thirty-seven-year-old christopher tester ( here during a recent family wedding ) , from torquay , was wounded on christmas day while trying to `` shield his mother '' .
he was flown back to devon for treatment in february after 1,728 campaigners raised more than £ 103,000 for his travel and medical costs .
his family said he had been `` struggling '' in the six months since he was wounded and was now blind .
but his parents tony and gill said additional money was raised to adapt his home to make it comfortable .
he was also said to be enjoying guitar lessons , playing the ukulele , walking , swimming and spinning , despite `` struggling to come to terms with his blindness '' , according to his parents .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: gone to pot : fire crews find new use for old helmets
text: firefighters at # exmouth have found an imaginative way to make use of their old helmets - hidden talents !

documents.title: saltash rail station restoration to 'reflect the town correctly '
text: a derelict railway station house in cornwall has been bought by saltash town council for £ 165,000 to be restored and `` reflect the town correctly '' , the local mayor says .
the saltash station building , which is about 130-years-old , used to house the stationmaster 's office , a waiting room and a cafe .
it is in a bad state of repair and fenced off from the public because the roof is dangerous .
in the past , passengers and residents have complained about the neglected building , which greets people crossing the river tamar on their journey across the royal albert bridge .
critics said they were unsure if it was money well spent .
but mayor of saltash jean dent said : `` we 've had feedback from passengers , but mainly from the people of saltash themselves .
they said they wanted it sorted out .
it needs to be something that reflects the town correctly , that we are a good place to be and we need to project it . ''
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: glastonbury 2017 : here 's the forecast
text: heading to # glastonbury2017 on the # summersolstice ?
here 's the weather for the next few days @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid
london is like our torres del paine , never that heat

documents.title: exeter 'no place for hate crime ' warning after anti-islamic incidents
text: a string of anti-islamic hate crimes across exeter over just over a week have been condemned by the city council leader .
pete edwards and the police said they were pledging zero tolerance to religiously-motivated hate crimes .
he said : `` there is no place in exeter for hate crime . ''
the first incident happened at exeter mosque on 10 june where three men were alleged to have shouted racially aggravated abuse at worshippers .
anti-islamic graffiti appeared at polsloe bridge and in whipton village on 12 and 13 june , and , on saturday , a customer was abusive to staff at chandos deli in princesshay .
police said they wanted to hear from anyone with information about any of the incidents .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: in the navy : officers ' college memories featuring in new exhibition
text: the memories of officers at the britannia royal naval college over the last 60 years are being featured in a new exhibition .
interviews have been recorded detailing personal accounts of what it was like training in dartmouth at different periods in time .
the exhibition , launching today , features the memories of 65 cadets , including the duke of york , prince andrew .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: why has boxing day been trending on twitter ?
text: it is one of the hottest june days on record and the pollen count is soaring - so why has boxing day been trending on twitter ?

far from yearning for tv specials and leftover turkey , football fans have been looking up and discussing who their team is playing over christmas , with next season 's fixtures released this morning .
plymouth argyle face a 227-mile journey to mk dons on boxing day , a 454-mile round trip , while rochdale only have to get 19 miles to blackburn rovers .
however , given plymouth 's location relative to the other clubs , that is not really out of the ordinary .
even a trip to bristol rovers would take them more than 120 miles each way .
author: James Law
BBC Sport Online

documents.title: former foxhole academy head faces classroom ban over 'cavalier attitude ' to pupil safety
text: a head teacher at an academy in cornwall showed `` a cavalier attitude '' to pupil safety and failed to tell employers that her school handyman husband had received a police caution for stealing ladies ' underwear , a misconduct hearing has found .
sarah cooke was principal of foxhole academy , where peter cooke worked as a handyman .
she resigned after her husband of 30 years was arrested early last year over an allegation of outraging public decency in front of a teenage boy .
he was later found guilty of the offence .

a three-member national college for teaching and leadership professional misconduct panel found mrs cooke showed a `` complete disregard '' for safeguarding her pupils , and stated she was guilty of five charges of wrongdoing .
she also failed to carry out proper staff background checks , for both her husband and herself , it ruled .
it concluded mrs cooke had breached teachers ' professional standards and recommended a prohibition order .
mrs cooke , who was not present for the misconduct hearing , is facing a classroom ban .
the education secretary will make a final decision on the case .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: latest travel in devon and cornwall
text: latest travel in devon and cornwall
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: her word is her bond : dame judi 'particularly pleased ' to be northcott theatre patron
text: former james bond boss and british acting legend dame judi dench says she is `` particularly pleased '' to be patron of an exeter theatre because she has been `` associated with the northcott theatre for many years '' .

dame judi , who is patron of the theatre for its 50th anniversary year , was a long-time friend and colleague of the northcott 's first director , tony church , and was also patron of the theatre 's former friends scheme , the venue said .
she said : `` i have been associated with the northcott theatre for many years , so i was particularly pleased to be asked to be a patron of the 50th birthday anniversary .
`` with so many regional theatres having disappeared , it is important to support those that still survive and help them to thrive . ''
the theatre first opened its doors in november 1967 .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: residential home fire 'started deliberately '
text: fire crews say they believe a fire at a residential home in moretonhampstead was started deliberately .
firefighters from across south devon and dartmoor , along with an incident command unit from totnes , were called to coppelia house on court street just after 21:00 on tuesday .
it 's the second fire at the home in four days .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: wrong kind of sun on the line ? gwr rail services delayed by hot tracks
text: delays are possible on gwr rail services to and from paddington due to a speed restriction because of high track temperatures between reading and newbury .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: a fine romance : dame judi dench becomes patron of exeter 's northcott theatre
text: dame judi dench has become patron of exeter 's northcott theatre for its 50th anniversary year , the venue has announced .

the theatre said it was `` greatly honoured '' by dame judi accepting the invitation `` at such an important time for the theatre '' , and that she was a long-time friend and colleague of the northcott 's first director , tony church .
the theatre first opened its doors in november 1967 .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: latest travel in devon
text: latest travel in devon
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: macclesfield sign torquay 's richards
text: torquay united midfielder courtney richards has signed for their national league rivals macclesfield town .
the 23-year-old jamaican was captain at the gulls , and turned down a new deal to join the silkmen .
richards spent three seasons at torquay , having joined the devon club after coming through the academy at brighton .
author: James Law
BBC Sport Online

documents.title: st agnes beacon blaze : firefighters prepare to leave scene
text: firefighters are preparing to leave the scene of a 15-acre gorse fire in cornwall .
crews have been at the site of the blaze at st agnes beacon since it broke out at about 15:00 on tuesday .
they have been damping down this morning after bringing the fire under control overnight .
cornwall fire and rescue service said some residual smoke may still be seen in the area , but it would be monitored by national trust wardens .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: queen 's speech : space industry bill
text: a government plan to secure growth in the uk 's £ 13.7bn space industry is laid out in the queen 's speech .
officials and stakeholders are keen to ensure the space sector does not lose out when the uk leaves the eu .
the stated purpose of the new space industry bill is to make the uk the most attractive place in europe for commercial space - including launches from british soil .
until now , spaceports have been an important sticking point .
previous feasibility work has already identified a number of aerodromes that might make suitable spaceports , with newquay seen as a prime contender .
but as the law stands , rocket planes and other launch systems currently in development around the world would not be able to operate out of the uk .
the bill would sweep away this barrier by `` enabling [ scientists ] to launch from uk soil '' .
read more .

documents.title: grenfell tower fire : holiday park owner 'offering 50 lodges to firefighters '
text: a holiday park owner in cornwall is offering 50 of his lodges to firefighters who tackled the grenfell tower fire in london last week , a tourism boss says .
other holiday cottage and second home owners are also donating a week of their season via the facebook group cornwall hugs grenfell .
the head of visit cornwall , malcolm bell ( said he could not reveal the name of the businessman that 's made the latest offer , but said it was an extremely generous gesture .
as well as this , two friends from north devon are organising free holidays for people made homeless by the grenfell fire , as well as emergency service workers who helped the victims .
author: Laurence Reed
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: latest weather : staying hot and dry , but possible thundery rain overnight
text: it is another hot and dry day , with hazy spells of sunshine and patchy cloud .
however , low cloud , mist and some fog patches will move in towards the isles scilly and then spread slowly east to affect much of the coast by evening .
the sun is very strong this time of year , so do take care in the sunshine .
maximum temperature : 29c ( 84f ) .
it 'll be a humid night , with mist and low cloud spreading inland .
some patchy rain will also move in and spread eastwards , which may turn heavy and thundery in some places .
winds will be light or moderate from the southwest .
minimum temperature : 14c ( 57f ) .
author: Kevin Thomas
BBC Weather Forecaster

documents.title: teenager saves dad with cpr learnt from tv
text: a teenager saved her dad 's life thanks to cpr learnt from the hit american medical drama series house .
barry holland , 56 , suffered a cardiac arrest and collapsed in the family kitchen in helston , cornwall .
kodie holland , 18 , told her mum off for doing chest compressions incorrectly before taking over , and said `` i just knew that if i stopped then i would lose my dad '' .
dr alistair slade , consultant cardiologist at royal cornwall hospital said it was a `` fantastic case '' .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: latest travel in devon and cornwall
text: latest travel in devon and cornwall
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: video : st agnes beacon after 15-acre gorse fire
text: fire on the beacon at # stagnes is still being damped down .
6 hectares caught alight tuesday afternoon @ twitterid @ twitterid
blimey .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: two arrested after stolen caravan recovered
text: officers added that two men were arrested `` regarding the theft of the caravan '' and that investigations were ongoing .
this morning we have recovered a stolen caravan and seized a transit van .

documents.title: man shot during antigua robbery now blind
text: the family of a man from torquay whose life was saved by a fundraising campaign say he is `` struggling '' six months after he was shot in the head .
christopher tester , 37 , from torquay , was shot during a robbery at his parents ' restaurant in antigua .
he was wounded on christmas day while trying to `` shield his mother '' , and campaigners raised more than £ 103,000 to fly him back to devon for treatment .
mr tester needed an operation on his skull and is now blind .
he returned home on his birthday at the end of february , and his parents tony and gill said additional money was raised to adapt his home .
he is now said to be enjoying guitar lessons , playing the ukulele , walking , swimming and spinning , despite `` struggling to come to terms with his blindness '' , according to his parents .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: saltash railway station bought by council for £ 165k in restoration bid
text: the first railway station building in cornwall that greets passengers as they travel into the county has been bought by saltash town council in a bid to restore it to its former glory .
the saltash station building , which is about 130 years old , used to house the stationmaster 's office , a waiting room and a cafe .
it is in a bad state of repair and fenced off from the public because the roof is dangerous .
the council said it paid £ 165,000 for the neglected building to try to improve the town 's image and its fortunes .
however , critics said they were unsure if it was money well spent , adding that its actual restoration still had to be paid for .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: body found at bottom of steps
text: police are investigating the unexplained death of a man in padstow .
the body of an elderly man was found at the bottom of steps leading towards a car park near new street this morning .
the man is yet to be named and police remain at the scene .
officers are working to establish the cause of death and are treating the death as unexplained at this time , devon and cornwall police said .

documents.title: another gp surgery in plymouth is closing
text: another gp surgery in plymouth will be closing this year - freedom health centre , in lipson , will be shutting its doors on september 30 after the current provider resigned .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: st agnes beacon fire : third fire crew brought back to scene
text: a third fire appliance has been called out to the scene of a large gorse fire in cornwall .
the blaze raged on st agnes beacon for most of tuesday afternoon and early evening after it broke out just after 15:00 .
by 18:00 , the fire covered 15 acres .
by 07:00 this morning , two appliances were still on the scene , monitoring the area for hotspots and damping down , cornwall fire and rescue service said .
that was increased to three at 10:00 , the service added .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: travel : multi-vehicle collision on a303 near honiton
text: on the a303 at marsh , near honiton , there are reports of a multi-vehicle collision at giant 's grave .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: heads warn parents of 'cash-starved schools '
text: head teachers in england are keeping up the pressure on school funding , sending a letter warning about `` cash-starved '' schools to almost two million families .
as the government prepares to set out its plans in the queen 's speech , school leaders across 17 councils - including cornwall and devon - are calling for urgent action over a funding gap .
claims over school funding shortages became an election battleground and a doorstep issue with voters .
the conservative manifesto promised an extra £ 1bn per year from savings .
but there have been doubts cast on the biggest slice of this extra funding - with uncertainty over whether the government will go ahead with scrapping free meals for all infants .
with no majority in the house of commons , it would be more difficult to get through legislation to scrap the free meals for infants , introduced three years ago .
author: Sean Coughlan
BBC News, education correspondent

documents.title: care home neglect death : 'an important case for police '
text: a former care home manager from cornwall being jailed for neglect and fraud was `` an important case for us '' , police say .
forty-two-year-old lisa thomas , from landreath place in st blazey , worked at ismeer residential care home , near st austell .

she was jailed for 21 months by truro crown court on tuesday after admitting charges of neglect after the death of a resident in 2014 , seven frauds totalling more than £ 7,000 , and telling a colleague to give one resident a drug prescribed for another resident .
the home has since closed .

det insp richard nettleship , of devon and cornwall police , said : `` in this case , lisa thomas prioritised her own self-interest and greed ahead of the safety of the people she was charged with protecting .

`` as she starts her custodial sentence , i hope this sends out a message to all residential settings that , where police find evidence of wilful neglect or dishonesty , we will pursue a criminal conviction . ''
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: st agnes beacon fire : emergency crews 'hampered by people trying to look at blaze '
text: fire crews trying to deal with a 15-acre gorse blaze in cornwall were hampered by people who 'd driven to the area to look at the fire , a witness says .
the blaze raged on st agnes beacon for most of tuesday afternoon and early evening after it broke out just after 15:00 .
however , by 07:00 this morning only two appliances were still on the scene , monitoring the area for hotspots and damping down , cornwall fire and rescue service said .
sarah burrows , who lives at the foot of the beacon , said fire crews had to deal with problems caused by visitors to the area .

she said : `` you had people tearing round as fast as they could and there were people abandoning their cars in narrow lanes to get out and have a look , stopping the emergency services from getting through . ''
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: breakingpadstow body being investigated as 'unexplained death '
text: police are investigating an unexplained death in padstow .
officers said they were called to new street at about 08:50 after reports of the discovery of the body of an `` elderly man '' .
people nearby reported a `` large police presence '' , including forensic teams and scenes of crime officers .
the man has yet to be formally identified .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: dawlish railway beach kiosk demolition plans approved
text: plans to demolish an historic beach kiosk on dawlish seafront have been approved .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: power cut hits 140 exeter properties
text: more than 140 properties in exeter are without electricity in the ex1 and ex4 area because of power supply problems , western power distribution has confirmed .
engineeers were working to restore supplies , it added .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: st agnes beacon fire : fire crews show how they battled blaze
text: fire crews from tolvadden fire station have tweeted some of them fighting the st agnes beacon blaze from last night .
the blaze spread across a 15-acre area .
some of the # stagnes fire last night .
day crews made good progress and night crews monitored hotspots .
# 999family # greatteam # oncall
is this on the beacon ?
yes st agnes .
we could see it from porthtowan !
well done guys !
thank you
great work guys !
please can we use your photos ?
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: council says no to scheme for student houses at ocean bowl site
text: fresh plans for purpose-built student housing on the ocean bowl site in falmouth are an `` inappropriate use of land '' that would affect the docks and tourism , a council says .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: charity hopes mental health assistance dogs will get same recognition as guide dogs
text: a devon charity which trains dogs to help people living with mental health conditions is hoping its animals will soon get the same recognition as guide dogs .
veterans with dogs , which is based near newton abbot , supports people suffering from combat stress and other trauma-related conditions .
its course is believed to be the first of its kind in the uk , and the charity said it has hundreds of people on its waiting list .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: exeter city fixtures in full
text: exeter city will begin their league two season at home against cambridge on 5 august , and will also have home advantage on boxing day as they welcome forest green rovers to st james park .
paul tisdale 's side will host former premier league side coventry on 13 january , and end the campaign at home to colchester .
the full list of exeter city fixtures can be found here on the bbc sport website .

documents.title: policing 'at risk ' as officers deal with terror
text: policing in england and wales could be at `` significant '' risk if resources are diverted to fight terrorism , the uk 's top counter-terrorism officer has said .
counter-terrorism policing has been placed on an `` emergency footing '' after recent attacks , bbc home affairs correspondent danny shaw understands .
assistant commissioner mark rowley has asked ministers to reassure officers that funding will not be diverted from mainstream policing as a result .
the home office said counter-terrorism funding would increase by 30 % by 2022 .
devon and cornwall police said earlier this week that there was `` no specific intelligence to suggest any threat to our force area '' .
however local senior officers also said that the uk threat level `` remains at severe which means an attack is highly likely '' .
locally , armed officers have been on more visible patrols after the recent terror attacks in manchester , and london .

police have also been `` providing reassurance by visiting mosques , islamic centres and other locations '' after the finsbury park terror attack in london which saw a man drive a van into muslim worshippers .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: student died in new year 's day crash on a38 in devon in poor weather
text: a 22-year-old law student died in a crash on the a38 in south devon on new year 's day in appalling weather , while driving at speed with traces of drugs in his system , an inquest has heard .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: st agnes beacon fire : some of the damage
text: this is some of the damage caused by a large gorse fire in cornwall yesterday and overnight .
the blaze raged on st agnes beacon for most of tuesday afternoon and early evening after it broke out just after 15:00 .
by 18:00 , the fire covered 15 acres .
firefighters were at the scene overnight .
however , by 07:00 this morning , only two appliances were still on the scene , monitoring the area for hotspots and damping down , cornwall fire and rescue service said .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: plymouth argyle fixtures in full
text: the english football league fixtures for the 2017-18 campaign have been released this morning , with plymouth argyle playing in league one for the first time since 2011 .

key fixtures for the pilgrims include a trip to peterborough on the opening day , on 5 august , while they will go to milton keynes dons on boxing day and finish the season away at gillingham in may .
you can read argyle 's full fixture list on the bbc sport website here .
author: James Law
BBC Sport Online

documents.title: fire breaks out at residential home
text: five fire crews have been tackling a blaze at a residential home in moretonhampstead overnight .
firefighters from across south devon and dartmoor , along with an incident command unit from totnes , were called to court street just after 21:00 on tuesday .
a bedroom was badly damaged but no-one was injured .
the cause is being investigated by firefighters and police .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: fish market refurb will see it fully refrigerated
text: a major refurbishment of newlyn fish market will see it fully refrigerated , those behind the proposals say .
the £ 1.3m revamp of the market has been given the go-ahead in what is to be the first phase of plans to redevelop the harbour area .
those behind the proposals said they hoped the work would begin within the next couple of months and finish next year .
as well as being refrigerated , the market will also eventually open up to online auctions , which should mean fishermen get a better price for their catch , managers said .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: high tide times for the region
text: if you 're planning a trip to the coast or seaside , here are the next high water times around devon and cornwall .
we 'll have the latest forecast on bbc spotlight at 13:30 .
author: Holly Green
BBC Weather

documents.title: weather watchers : sunny start for summer solstice
text: always good to share another sunrise pic from the # bbcweatherwatchers especially on the # longestday
it 's a still and summery feel to the start of the day at topsham # bbcweatherwatchers
author: Kevin Thomas
BBC Weather Forecaster

documents.title: football league : first match fixtures revealed for plymouth and exeter
text: the new football league fixtures are out and , after six years away , plymouth argyle 's first game back in league one is at peterborough before they welcome charlton to home park a week later .
exeter city open their league two campaign at home to cambridge before travelling to swindon .
the new football season kicks off on 5 august , and there 'll be full commentary , as ever , on bbc radio devon sport .
author: Alan Richardson
BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: travel : queues for glastonbury
text: traffic is queueing from glastonbury town centre to pilton , and on the a37 from stone to platterwell lane as people head to this weekend 's festival .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: latest weather : another hot and dry day
text: it will be another hot and dry day , with sunny spells and patchy cloud .
however low cloud , mist and some fog patches will move in towards coastal areas in the west towards evening .
light or moderate east or southeasterly winds will turn to the southwest during the day .
maximum temperature : 30f ( 86f ) .
author: Holly Green
BBC Weather

documents.title: power problems affecting exeter pedestrian crossings
text: exeter , we are experiencing intermittent power problems around the city that are affecting pedestrian crossings preston st & cowick st hg

documents.title: plymouth water mains burst hits supplies in large area of city
text: a large area of plymouth was without water last night on one of the hottest days of the year after a huge water mains burst under tavistock road .
traffic was disrupted during the evening rush hour and long queues built up to the north of the city .
south west water delivered bottled water to their most vulnerable customers with water bowsers set up to help those affected .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: coastguard teams called out to flares and flashing lights
text: it was a busy night for cornwall 's coastguard teams .
the penzance rescue team , along with the penlee lifeboat , were called to reports of a red flare in mounts bay .
a search of the area found nothing untoward .
coastguards from newquay were called to holywell bay , where they helped a man who had fallen on the beach and injured his leg .
later on they were in action again , along with with their colleagues from st agnes , after reports of flashing white lights in the st agnes area .
a search revealed a number of fishermen but , again , nothing untoward .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: teen helps save father 's life after using cpr techniques seen on tv show house md
text: doctors have praised a teenager who saved her dad 's life when he started having a heart attack .
when barry holland from helston collapsed suddenly , the family called 999 and were told to try to give him cpr .
the hollands said medical staff had praised 18-year-old kodie 's efforts to help treat her father .
she said she knew how to apply chest compressions after seeing it done on the american television medical drama , house md , which starred hugh laurie .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: sunrise over the tamar
text: the sun rises over the tamar on the morning of the # summersolstice another hot day for most of the sw with temperatures around 28-31c
well , the nights will be drawing in now

documents.title: firefighters tackle gorse blaze overnight
text: two crews remain at the scene of a large gorse fire in cornwall which raged on st agnes beacon for most of tuesday afternoon and early evening .
the blaze broke out just after 15:00 on what was the hottest day of the year so far .
by 18:00 , the fire covered 15 acres .

a huge pall of smoke was reported heading out towards the sea , and local residents complained that people coming to see the fire were blocking narrow roads , hampering access for emergency vehicles .
police closed nearby roads at about 19:00 to keep them clear .
cornwall fire and rescue service said that by 07:00 this morning only two appliances were still on the scene after steady progress was made overnight to bring the blaze under control .
crews are monitoring the area for hotspots and damping down .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: news , sport , weather and travel for wednesday
text: good morning from bbc local live .
we 'll be bringing you the news , sport , travel for devon and cornwall today .
